objective: Write a C++ program that prints the following exact text to stdout: Hello EduCode!
Write a C++ program that prints the sum of two integers (3 and 4). Output must be a single integer.

Print two lines exactly as below:
Line1: Hello
Line2: EduCode
Declare two integer variables a=10 and b=5, compute and print 'a b sum' separated by spaces (a, b, sum).
Compute and print the floating point division of 7 by 2 with one decimal place (format like 3.5).
Read a single word (no spaces) from stdin and print its length as an integer.
Read two integers from stdin and print their product.
Read an integer n and print n squared.
Read an integer and print 'Even' if it's even, otherwise print 'Odd'.
Read an integer n and print the sum of integers from 1 to n inclusive.
Read integers until a zero is read; print the count of positive numbers encountered (exclude zero).
Read n followed by n integers, print the maximum value.
Implement a program that reads two integers and prints their gcd (greatest common divisor). You may write helper functions.
Define a class 'Rectangle' with width and height, read two integers and print area using the class. You may create additional methods.
Read n and n integers, output the frequency of each distinct integer in ascending order of the integer. Format each line as 'value count'.
